alert.note: Alert for Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 7:20PM MST until July 21 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Backbone Fire scar in... Gila County in east central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 719 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Backbone Fire scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Backbone Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Backbone Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila and Yavapai Counties This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes and waterfalls on Fossil Creek and Fossil Creek Dam "The Toilet Bowl". This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hardscrabble Creek, Verde River, Fossil Creek and Strawberry Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get to higher ground immediately and stay away from Fossil Creek! Flash flood waters and debris will inundate swimming holes and recreation trails crossing washes within and downstream of the Backbone Fire scar.
